greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Largest odd number that can be represented in exactly n ways as p+2*i^2 where p is 1 or a prime and i >= 0.
comment: These are just the largest numbers presently known - it has not been proved that they are really the largest.
link: L. Hodges, A lesser-known Goldbach conjecture, Math. Mag., 66 (1993), 45-47.
Index entries for sequences related to Goldbach conjecture
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_
ext: The sequence as given in the Hodge paper is incorrect; corrected and extended by _Jud McCranie_, Jun 12 2000
